titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Margaret Judson Papers, approximately 1915
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Mark Seidl

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Seven complete typescripts of Judson's "Pride and Prejudice: A Play in Three Acts"; 19 extra pages, several with Judson's annotations in ink.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Margaret Judson graduated from Vassar in 1903 with an AB in English. After teaching English for two years at Simmons College, she returned to Vassar in 1905 as an Instructor in English. She continued to teach at Vassar over the succeeding several years, with periodic absences to study at Yale and serve as Dean of Women and Professor of English at Denison University. In 1916 she was promoted at Vassar to Associate Professor of English. In addition to teaching, Judson wrote and published poetry and adapted Jane Austen's Pride and Prejudice for the stage. Born in Orange, NJ, she died in Cazenovia, NY, on July 6, 1963.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Seven complete typescripts of Judson's "Pride and Prejudice: A Play in Three Acts"; 19 extra pages, several with Judson's annotations in ink.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection processed by Mark Seidl, April 2014.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Original acquisition date unknown. Transferred from Special Collections Dewey material on March 28, 2014 (M2014-004).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Margaret Judson Papers, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.
